description.narrative: Denna insats utgör andra fasen av ett samarbete mellan Myndigheten för Landrestitution och CCJ där, under första fasen, 673 familjer har erhållit legal representation och kunnat presentera sina anspråk för de agrara domstolarna under 2014. Insatsen syftar till att upprätthålla denna legala representation och övervakning av fallen till dess att domstolsutfall har erhållits. Utöver detta kommer CCJ under den andra fasen av insatsen att representera och framföra anspråk för 700 ytterligare fall. Insatsen kommer således att gagna minst 1400 familjer som är offer för olagligt förvärv av land, under år 2015. Den totala budgeten för insatsen uppgår till 11,3 MSEK, av vilka Myndigheten för Landrestitution finansierar 3 MSEK. CCJ har ansökt till Sida om finansiering av de återstående 8,3 MSEK för insatsen.

This contribution is the second phase of an association agreement between the Unit for land restitution and CCJ where 673 families had legal representation and claims were presented to agrarian judges in 2014. This contribution aims at maintaining this legal representation and monitoring of cases until the judge ruling is produced. In addition CCJ will represent and present claims for 700 additional cases. So the intervention will benefit at least 1400 families victim's of land dispossession during 2015.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Until December 2016, the Colombian Commission of jurist, in association with the Unit for Land Restitution, have represented 1285 cases of land dispossession before the agrarian judges that correspond to 5316 victims (2708 men and 2608 women) as well as and 103 additional legal processes for victims (before the Unit for victim’s reparations, the National Unit for protection and ordinary judges for procedural fraud or criminal proceedings). This legal representation was grouped in 281 processes in 27 judicial offices nationwide. 135 rulings were issued conferring land restitution for victims.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
